alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Dinwiddie; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 6:25PM EDT until May 13 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN AMELIA, CENTRAL PRINCE EDWARD, NORTHERN DINWIDDIE AND NOTTOWAY COUNTIES... At 625 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding on Route 460 near Farmville. Flooding is likely ongoing in other portions of the warned area as well. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dinwiddie, Farmville, Blackstone, Crewe, Mannboro, Longwood University, Hampden Sydney, Nottoway, Burkeville, Spainville, Jetersville, Wilsons, Rice, Sutherland, Prospect, Denaro, Clay Store, Fergusonville, Pattersons Store and Maplewood. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
